main event: A witness observed a bright, changing object in the sky over Franklinton, Ohio on October 17, 1959.
interesting points: The object changed in size, becoming larger and smaller repeatedly during the 30-minute observation.
The object moved up, down, and side-to-side, described as a 'bright star or possibly another bright craft or planet in the sky'.
The witness compared the object's size to 'the size of a dime from horizon to horizon' at its largest.
No specific positional information was obtained from the witness.
The witness stated the luminous colors and constant movement of the light bothered them.
sighted object: a bright, changing object in the sky
